                            <gmd:role>

                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"

                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Kawartha Water Watch was established in the summer of 1997, the KWW water quality program was implemented to monitor and improve the health of the Kawartha watershed.  Using data collected from the program, we can develop appropriate remedial measures that can be undertaken by the public to improve the ecosystem health. This program is designed to provide information on the water quality status of our aquatic resources accomplished through the combination of information from our own sampling efforts and from Provincial agencies, KWW allows for the identification of good, satisfactory and poor water quality. Water quality, for the purposes of KWW, applies mainly to Phosphate and Nitrogen concentration, coliform presence, pH, alkalinity, water clarity, and turbidity, as sampled by volunteers of the program. KWW is a program that relies almost entirely on the watershed community to monitor the water quality of our lakes and rivers. Volunteers sample water from their respective water bodies on a monthly basis, sending the results to Kawartha Conservation where they are organized, analyzed, and reported on.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-23c7-rv95
notes: Kawartha Water Watch was established in the summer of 1997, the KWW water quality program was implemented to monitor and improve the health of the Kawartha watershed.  Using data collected from the program, we can develop appropriate remedial measures that can be undertaken by the public to improve the ecosystem health. This program is designed to provide information on the water quality status of our aquatic resources accomplished through the combination of information from our own sampling efforts and from Provincial agencies, KWW allows for the identification of good, satisfactory and poor water quality. Water quality, for the purposes of KWW, applies mainly to Phosphate and Nitrogen concentration, coliform presence, pH, alkalinity, water clarity, and turbidity, as sampled by volunteers of the program. KWW is a program that relies almost entirely on the watershed community to monitor the water quality of our lakes and rivers. Volunteers sample water from their respective water bodies on a monthly basis, sending the results to Kawartha Conservation where they are organized, analyzed, and reported on.

notes_translated.en: Kawartha Water Watch was established in the summer of 1997, the KWW water quality program was implemented to monitor and improve the health of the Kawartha watershed.  Using data collected from the program, we can develop appropriate remedial measures that can be undertaken by the public to improve the ecosystem health. This program is designed to provide information on the water quality status of our aquatic resources accomplished through the combination of information from our own sampling efforts and from Provincial agencies, KWW allows for the identification of good, satisfactory and poor water quality. Water quality, for the purposes of KWW, applies mainly to Phosphate and Nitrogen concentration, coliform presence, pH, alkalinity, water clarity, and turbidity, as sampled by volunteers of the program. KWW is a program that relies almost entirely on the watershed community to monitor the water quality of our lakes and rivers. Volunteers sample water from their respective water bodies on a monthly basis, sending the results to Kawartha Conservation where they are organized, analyzed, and reported on.
notes_translated.fr: Kawartha Water Watch a été créé à l'été 1997 et le programme de qualité de l'eau KWW a été mis en œuvre pour surveiller et améliorer la santé du bassin versant de Kawartha. À l'aide des données recueillies dans le cadre du programme, nous pouvons élaborer des mesures correctives appropriées qui peuvent être prises par le public pour améliorer la santé de l'écosystème. Ce programme est conçu pour fournir des informations sur l'état de la qualité de l'eau de nos ressources aquatiques grâce à la combinaison d'informations provenant de nos propres efforts d'échantillonnage et celles des agences provinciales. KWW permet d'identifier une eau de bonne, satisfaisante et mauvaise qualité. Aux fins du KWW, la qualité de l'eau s'applique principalement à la concentration de phosphate et d'azote, à la présence de coliformes, au pH, à l'alcalinité, à la clarté de l'eau et à la turbidité, tels qu'échantillonnés par des volontaires du programme. KWW est un programme qui s'appuie presque entièrement sur la communauté du bassin versant pour surveiller la qualité de l'eau de nos lacs et rivières. Des bénévoles prélèvent des échantillons d'eau de leurs plans d'eau respectifs sur une base mensuelle et envoient les résultats à Kawartha Conservation, où ils sont organisés, analysés et publiés.

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Kawartha Region Conservation Authority Kawartha Water Watch Data

title_translated.fr: Données de surveillance de l'eau de Kawartha de l'Office de protection de la nature de la région de Kawartha
